file_content.text: So your Master was here all along. Well-played, Padawan. Your lies convinced even Darth Angral.
Who are you? What are you doing here?
Explain yourself.
Put down that lightsaber and step away from my Padawan.
Drop your weapon, Sith.
Spare me your pathetic demands. I hold the power here, not you.
You had one job while I was gone, Padawan. Can't you do anything right?
You messed-up bad, Kira.
Nice to see you, too.
Imperial Intelligence noticed this girl wandering the station and alerted my master.
Darth Angral came from twenty parsecs away for a personal interrogation. Unfortunately, we were led to believe you weren't here.
Told them you were on Corellia. Suckers.
No matter. We have you now. Surrender--unless you want your Padawan to die.
He's lying. He can't kill me. Angral's orders.
Release my Padawan. It's your only way out of this.
Then let Kira go, Sith.
Why does Angral want you alive?
Orders?
Don't worry about me. Get rid of Lord Pompous here.
I'm going to kill you.
You do realize you're vastly outnumbered? Not to mention outmatched.
I'll never understand what drives you Jedi to throw away your lives.
You risk certain death to free this girl. Why? Some misguided sense of duty?
Jedi accept responsibility for others. Sith only care about themselves.
It's not misguided.
You're as dull as you are pointless. Let's get this over with.
I'm not here to discuss philosophy.
Skip the questions.
Unfortunate. It would have bought you a few extra moments of life.
This isn't about duty. It's personal.
I care for Kira.
I care a great deal about my Padawan--and I'll punish anyone who threatens her.
This goes beyond duty.
My, aren't you the interesting one. Pity you have to die.
When I present Darth Angral with your head, he'll be most appreciative.
